alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County; North Laramie Range; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 8:20PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Albany, west central Goshen, northwestern Laramie and Platte Counties through 930 PM MDT... At 819 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Guernsey to 7 miles east of Baldy Peak. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wheatland, Guernsey, Lingle, Fort Laramie, Chugwater, Chugcreek, Lakeview North, Bordeaux, Westview Circle, Y-O Ranch, Two Moon Campground, Iron Mountain, Baldy Peak, Fort Laramie National Historic Site, Slater, Grayrocks Reservoir, Horse Creek, Guernsey Campground, Glendo Reservoir and Hartville. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 44 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
